episode_summary: This episode features discussions on ancient dentistry, the phantom time theory, the medical importance of horseshoe crabs, and Queen Elizabeth I's sleeping arrangements. Special guests Alex Edelman and Greg Jenner join the regular hosts for this episode.

facts.fact: The earliest known dentistry is 9,000 years old, with evidence of teeth being drilled in what is now modern-day Pakistan.
A theory from Dr. Hans Ulrich Neymitz suggests that the Middle Ages never happened, known as the phantom time theory.
The most medically indispensable sea creature in the United States is the horseshoe crab, whose blood is used to test for bacterial endotoxins in new drugs.
There are 28 people known to have slept in the same bedroom as Queen Elizabeth I, and they were all women.
